FriendsSitcom The One Where They Crash-Land (Friends) The cast of the hit 1990s sitcom *Friends* has crash-landed on a RimWorld after their chartered shuttle went down. Stranded together, Ross, Rachel, Monica, Chandler, Joey, and Phoebe must survive harsh conditions armed with nothing but their friendship, sarcasm, and questionable survival skills.
The six friends crash-land together. Expect drama, romance, and coffee.

GameStartDialog The six friends were returning from an extravagant Glitterworld vacation—spa domes, endless buffets, even a holographic Central Perk—when disaster struck. An asteroid storm tore through their ship, sending escape pods scattering across the Rim. Now stranded on a desolate world with no coffee, no Wi-Fi, and no Gunther to bring refills, they must build a new life from the wreckage. Ross insists this counts as a "fascinating anthropological opportunity," Monica has already started cleaning the dirt, and Joey keeps asking if anyone ordered pizza. Could this be any more dramatic? GameStartSting
AlwaysSunnySitcom The Gang Crashes on the Rim (It’s Always Sunny) The Gang from *It’s Always Sunny in Philadelphia* has somehow crash-landed on a RimWorld. Armed with no morals, no plan, and far too much confidence, Dennis, Dee, Mac, Charlie, and Frank must survive a harsh alien world where their scams, schemes, and sheer stupidity might be their only weapons.
The Gang crash-lands together. Expect chaos, betrayal, and milk.

GameStartDialog The Gang was on a luxury shuttle to a corporate retreat when Mac tried to "upgrade" the engine for more thrust, Dennis attempted to seduce the autopilot, and Charlie released a swarm of space rats. The Dean is already drafting announcements.

GameStartDialog The Bluth Company shuttle was supposed to land at a luxury resort for an image makeover. Instead, a debris strike scattered the pods onto a dusty RimWorld with no banana stand, no stair car, and no legal counsel. Michael declares a fresh start. Gob promises a prestige. Lucille demands a drink. George Sr. whispers through vents. Buster panics about the beach. Lindsay founds a charity in name only. Tobias announces he’s between roles and pants. Maeby quietly greenlights the colony. You’ve made a huge decision. GameStartSting

Jack, Kate, Sawyer, Locke, Hurley, Sayid, Sun, Jin, and Claire arrive together. Expect leadership struggles, jungle expeditions, and strange signals.

GameStartDialog The roar of engines becomes a scream, then nothing but surf and fire. You wake among twisted metal and shattered luggage, the jungle staring back like a living thing. Smoke rises in black ribbons above the wreck of Flight 815. Jack is already shouting for survivors, Kate drags someone from the tide, Sawyer pockets a lighter, Locke smiles at the trees. Somewhere beyond the palms, a strange signal repeats in static. The island hums beneath your feet—ancient, patient, and waiting. GameStartSting
TheOfficeSitcom Dunder Mifflin on the Rim (The Office) The Dunder Mifflin Scranton branch was on a corporate retreat to the Glitterworld of Utica when Michael took control of the shuttle’s PA system. A “motivational announcement” led to confusion, mild panic, and one disastrous button press. Now the entire office has crash-landed on a RimWorld—armed with sarcasm, memos, and a shocking lack of survival instincts.
Michael, Jim, Pam, Dwight, Angela, Kevin, and the rest of Dunder Mifflin try to survive the Rim. Expect awkward meetings, beet farming, and coffee shortages.

GameStartDialog Michael called this retreat “The Conference Room of Tomorrow.” It lasted twelve seconds before the shuttle alarms went off. Now the Dunder Mifflin team has landed on a barren RimWorld with nothing but binders, coffee mugs, and an almost supernatural ability to generate awkwardness. Dwight has assumed command. Jim disagrees. Pam’s drawing the crater. Angela’s judging everyone. Kevin found snacks. Creed found a knife. And somewhere in the wreckage, Michael’s still giving his opening speech. GameStartSting
